response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 2 cups sugar, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1 tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, combine 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla, and 1 cup boiling water. Whisk until smooth. Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined—do not overmix.",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Place in the oven and bake 25–30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks.",
  "step4": "While cakes cool, prepare frosting: beat ½ cup softened butter until fluffy. Gradually add 3 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat until light and creamy, adding more milk if needed for spreadable consistency.",
  "step5": "Once cakes are cool, level tops with a knife if uneven. Place one layer on a serving plate, spread a generous layer of frosting. Top with the second layer, then frost the sides and top of the cake. Smooth with a spatula for a clean finish.",
  "step6": "Refrigerate the finished cake for 15 minutes to set the frosting. Slice, serve, and enjoy the moist, rich chocolate cake—perfect for 8 guests!"
}
